DataElement.preferredName: Patient Protocol Requirement Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has meet the defined protocol testing requirements as criteria to determine eligibility for participating in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person meeting the defined protocol requirements as criteria to determine eligibility for participating in a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:Required; necessary, not optional.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do the testing values/results
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do the testing values/results meet the eligibility criteria as specified in Section 3.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet any of the following criteria:

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient between 365-547 days old with newly diagnosed INSS Stage 4 neuroblastoma with any of the following unfavorable biologic features or any biologic feature that is indeterminate/unsatisfactory/unknown?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you plan to follow the guidelines set is section 3.28 of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet eligibility criteria for the non-chemotherapy cohort per protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet eligibility criteria for the chemotherapy cohort per protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all clinical studies, if applicable, obtained within 21 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all clinical studies, if applicable, performed within 21 days prior to enrollment and start of protocol therapy (repeat if necessary) unless otherwise indicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all clinical studies (eg, cardiac imaging, pulmonary function tests), if applicable, obtained within 21 days prior to enrollment and start of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all clinical studies, if applicable, performed within 28 days prior to enrollment and start of protocol therapy (repeat if necessary) unless otherwise indicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are clinical studies (e.g., cardiac imaging, pulmonary function tests) obtained within 21 days prior to enrollment and start of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all clinical studies and disease/staging imaging studies (if applicable) obtained within 42 days prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is it feasible for plasma CMV PCR testing to be sent and resulted within the protocol mandated time period?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.4.4 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002268. ak 2023.3.17 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002164. ak 2023.3.6 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak 2022.8.31 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001542. ak 2022.9.26 AQT and Alt SN added for ticket request CADSR0001472. ak 2022.11.8 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001669. cjl
